extendedIngredients.name: low sodium soy sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c. soy sauce (tamari soy sauce or reduced-sodium is fine if you prefer)
metaInformation: (tamari soy sauce or is if you prefer)

extendedIngredients.name: white rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: cooked rice (I like medium grain white rice for this dish)

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Adobo

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: In your slow cooker, whisk together soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, and brown sugar. Add jalapeño and chicken, and spoon sauce over chicken to cover. Place lid on slow cooker, and cook on low for 4-5 hours, or until chicken is tender.About a half hour before serving (I do this when I start the rice), stir cornstarch into cold water with a fork until dissolved, and pour into slow cooker. Gently stir, and continue cooking.Serve chicken and sauce over rice, and garnish with green onions if desired.

steps.step: In your slow cooker, whisk together soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, and brown sugar.
Add jalapeño and chicken, and spoon sauce over chicken to cover.

Place lid on slow cooker, and cook on low for 4-5 hours, or until chicken is tender.About a half hour before serving (I do this when I start the rice), stir cornstarch into cold water with a fork until dissolved, and pour into slow cooker. Gently stir, and continue cooking.
Serve chicken and sauce over rice, and garnish with green onions if desired.
